summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 between law enforcement officers, likely part of the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force, coordinating interviews of Jeffrey Epstein's prior employees. The emails discuss tracking down an 80-year-old former employee who worked at Epstein's New York home during the abuse period, and mention subpoenas and address searches.

persons.name: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: The primary author of the emails, coordinating the investigation into Epstein's prior employees and requesting assistance with interviews.

events.title: Law enforcement coordination on employee interviews
events.description: Law enforcement officers exchange emails about tracking down and interviewing prior employees of Jeffrey Epstein who worked at his New York home during the period abuse was occurring.
personsInvolved: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force

keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively seeking to interview prior employees of Jeffrey Epstein in July 2019, specifically those who worked at his New York home during the abuse period.
One target was an 80-year-old former employee who had been living in Nassau County since 2000 and may have worked at Epstein's NY address before Epstein lived there, when it was owned by Wexner.
Investigators were prepared to use subpoenas if the employee refused to be interviewed, and questions focused on knowledge of Epstein, the massage room, and girls coming and going.
A second New York employee was also being sought, but law enforcement lacked a date of birth or good address for them at the time.
